page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: Cultivated farmland covers most of the area except for the Eastern part where rough grassland covers poor sandy soils. To the south Leuchars Airfield occupies land which would otherwise be farmland. The farms are large, concentrating on 'cash crops' such as barley and potatoes; but they also run small herds of cattle for fattening. To feed the cattle rotation grass and turnips are grown. Sheep are only present in Autumn and Winter when they are brought in from the Highlands to be fed on turnips for fattening. Most of the jobs on the farms are now highly mechanised with the result that a few skilled workers are now employed. Because of this trend many farm cottages are either unoccupied or have been sold or rented to people who want to live in the counryside. Farming in this area is prosperous.
